review_title: Nurse Technician at Tanner Health System
job_title: Nurse Technician in Carrollton, GA
pros: I like how Tanner has different units. That way, you get experience working in different specialties when you pick up shifts on other floors. The pay is great, and you are compensated well. Your pay differs based on the floor you work, the shift (day or night), your employment status (full-time or PRN), float differential, overtime, and so on. Tanner encourages their workers to go back to school. They offer tuition reimbursement i
cons: The patient-to-nurse technician ratio is high. Working here involves high acuity as my floor is always short-staffed on nights. You are overworked

review_title: It's worth a drive to Atlanta for proper medical care.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Carrollton, GA
pros: The insurance. Co-workers in your department are generally nice. Patients are usually nice despite their situation. My direct supervisor was kind, but several of the supervisors in my department had Napoleon complexes.
cons: Management is only interested in patient satisfaction at the cost of employee satisfaction. Nursing staff is generally slow to respond to patients and generally sit around and don't know their patients from Adam. Doctors are rarer than hen's teeth. These roles affect other departments, and the nurses could stand to look in the mirror before they get an attitude or accost another employee.

job_title: Business Office in Carrollton, GA
pros: I loved working at Tanner. Senior management makes a great effort to show that they care about all employees, and have regular hospital wide meetings to keep staff informed of upcoming changes and current status of the hospital. They offer a discount on insurance premiums for meeting certain health standards (blood pressure, cholesterol, etc) and if you don't meet these standards offer online classes you can take to still receive the discount. Lots of employee events...I wish I could work here again but relocated to Atlanta and the drive is just too far. I now work for another hospital system and there are exponential differences between the two. Tanner is truly making an effort  to expand and become a leader in the healthcare field. Great example of work/life balance. Raises depending on performance and yearly bonuses.
cons: Challenges for me were working in a very small and conservative town (which equaled conservative coworkers!) This was very challenging at times...I find my coworkers at my current job are much more open-minded.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Villa Rica, GA
pros: Decent benefits, but insurance plan could be better considering it is a hospital. 401K matching is good. That is really it.
cons:
Pay is a joke. I easily got a similar job with another company that paid better. 

They once closed an entire department for sketchy reasons and laid off all of the employees only to reopen it 6 months later. After that, it felt like there was no job security.  Not a fun environment. 

Management used to care about employee satisfaction and patient care. Things were so much better back then. Now, they only care about money. They bleed the Medicaid and Medicare systems by keeping patients longer than necessary. They claim their employee satisfaction surveys are anonymous but they are not.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Carrollton, GA
pros: Tanner does a good job with keeping up with pay rates and has a good benefit plan.  They encourage promotion from within and dedicate resources to training managers how to be leaders and growing employees allowing for career paths.  This is evidenced by the number of long term employees.  Work family is really close in most areas.  Everyone is focused on taking care of the patient and work well together across teams.
cons: None other than working at a hospital is the hardest but most rewarding job ever.

job_title: Coordinator in Carrollton, GA
pros: My department is very family oriented.  My hours are perfect for a working mom.
cons: Tanner should provide office employees (not direct healthcare workers) with paid holidays instead of making them take their PTO.

job_title: Non-clinical Professional in Carrollton, GA
pros: Working in a non-profit healthcare setting is very rewarding. Employees and leadership really care about each other and the community. Most employees see their work not as a job but as a service to others. Bonus program that rewards employees when the organization succeeds. Tanner is financially responsible and committed to serving the community for the long-term.
cons: The pressures of healthcare reform and the changing healthcare industry have made it really challenging for leadership and employees. Although it gives us an opportunity to pull together to face the challenges, it won't be easy.
